comments.body: Rather than decreasing the enchanting price, I would have Amethyst slightly increase the chance for rare enchantments to appear on the armor, tool, or perhaps book that it is applied to. This could be useful for certain armor types, like Diamond, which are less likely to obtain high-level enchants.

This is not the same as real life though. Goats are the ‘unique jumping mob’, although you cannot ride them. Horses can already jump a maximum of 5.5 blocks, and adding more than that for alpacas would be ridiculous in my opinion. Just give a llama jump boost if you want the same effect.

Su questo hai ragione magari si abbassa il salto al cavallo e si alza al lama sia in altezza sia in lunghezza come mezzo di trasporto delle montagne dato che nel aggiornamento che verrà, le montagne saranno più alte

Great idea, but I have another suggestion. Combining 1 glow lichen & 1 glow ink sac makes the light level go 3 levels higher & combining 8 glow lichen surrounding 1 glow ink sac, gets them all 1 light level higher, so you can customize the glow lichen's light levels however you like. If you keep combining it with glow ink sacs it will eventually get to the highest light level. This would be great to bring a variety of light levels while subtly so you don't have to use torch spamming.

You should also be able to dye the glow lichen so you customize it a lot more & if you combine a moss carpet with a low lichen it should take away it's light level & dye color if you want it to be dark & back to its original color.
Would the boxes be destroted upon opening? If not, they could be used to hold and protect your items

Actually, maybe they should break after being opened, otherwise they could be used like Shulker Boxes, as I imagine that they'd have to hold the items when destroyed otherwise people would just skip the puzzles and mine the block

In my original thought, the Enigma Box would disappear, leaving the loot behind, after it had been solved. However, I had not really thought about the capabilities of a reusable Enigma Box. If it were made reusable, they could stand in for locked chests.

Yes! This sounds epic! The diamonds should spawn in small one veins though and should be in the center of the mountain. This would help bad players in the early game get some good loot. Most people only use diamonds temporarily before getting netherite, so it would make sense for this to be a feature! Good job.
netherite is intended to be end game, diamond is intended to be REALLY hard to get. It should stay that way, so at least make the coal mountain a rare biome.
i feel they should also add new trees to the mountainsides like maybe mountain ash ,alder, or hawthorn trees maybe even pine trees

I feel like this is awesome, It gives a solution to the issue that coal feels kinda rare in the lategame, also, a biome where diamonds can spawn at any level, but above 16 they spawned in veins of only 1 or 2, would be cool, 1.17 is supposed to change mining stategy, why not have a mountain that encourages you to make an open pit mine, instead of just strip mining, as even though the veins of diamonds are smaller, if you are in the midgame, that is worth extracting from the mountain, not to mention the huge amount of coal the thing would produce, I feel like there could be other variations too, a mountain with common iron(iron is really important in the midgame and lategame, for redstone, but the supply decreases over time, as it is mined, but you need a lot of it(36 ingots to make a golem), and also, Iron farms ARE NOT an excuse(they dont work at any reasonable speed on bedrock, and giving an easy way to pit mine for iron would be perfect, as it would give players all the iron they would need for a LONG time(10k+ iron ore, max of 50k) and as you mine the mountain, another way to fuel progress like this could be steel, which would be a new set in between iron and diamond in strength(durability and armor points, mining speed too, dmg, nope, it stays the same) steel would be created from coal and iron. and the value of steel as being a block that would be able to be used for engine carts(replacement for furnace carts, can push up to 3 minecarts at max speed, up hills.
Yes! but instead of a "medium" TNT how about ores that explode when you walk near them? And instead of crafting something we can mine using silk touch whilst sneaking.
what if we get sulfer deposits near the lava and you break it and get sulfer powder and four sulfer powder turns into one gunpowder
im all for it excpet the tool varients i think we should also have cobble varietys of the other stone types as well
Sounds great... maybe you could make them different colors like leather armor
Leather already saves you from powered snow though...

I have an idea for something similar. You would still get the freeze effect, and a light/heat source would prevent this, but additionally the snow particles would be twice as plentiful, and the rate of snow layers spawning would be doubled, as well as multiple snow layers being allowed to stack naturally during snow storms.
This would be an amazing biome for caves and cliffs. Maybe you can find piles of logs on the surface to indicate that there's a petrified forest below.
maybe basalt could be used for logs instead of adding a new block, as they look sort of like logs
Actual petrified wood would be such a good building block though.
How do you think the village type would look like?
this would be an amazing oportunity to re add the OG wooden slab from beta (witch acted like a stone slab but with the wood texture)

So, Mothra? I'm incredibly down, I just can't see the Minecraft Team getting on board with this. However! Since they've already introduced bees, I think butterflies and moths could be a very cute regional variant. In this case, neither mob would even need to serve a direct purpose, but rather exist passively, simply to add more wonder and beauty to the land. Maybe they could (on rare occasions) drop phantom membrane, or their own variant of a butterfly wing. Very interesting idea!! :)
Giant butterfly
There could also be tiny flying ants that stay near light sources.
Other than riding in large caverns, it would be very hard to fly through caves on them.

since you mentioned bamboo, maybe it can work like bamboo in that it generates/places in a random spot on the block, and give a little variety when there's multiple dripstones next to each other. I think that would also help it look a little more "natural"

also i really agree I don't like how part of the dripstone model hangs off of the block into the next block over :/
Yeah i wish they fix it just like how they did to spyglass

With the current texture it looks like you should be able to walk through the block like sugarcane or sweet berries. I think it would be better if it were more like bamboo, walls and cactus where it's a solid model but it tapers to a point.

While this is a good idea, the wiggling doesn't do anything with the vibration signals, therefore the string wouldn't stop it. Think of it as a hostile glow squid. You wrap up the tentacles from them attacking you, but they still glow. Now imagine the tentacles as the sculk sensor tentacles and the glowing as the sensor detecting the vibrations. It's like that.
They should also break out after a specific amount of time, emitting no signals when breaking free. This would help us build traps near sculk sensors more effectively.

In response to Blast Burner, I think it does make sense. Our ears work by sensing vibrations in the air. How? We have things in there that vibrate at the same frequency as the air that comes in. Our brain senses the things in our ears that vibrate, and measures the vibrations, which we interpret as pitch. If the skulk sensors vibratey things are unable to vibrate, the skulk sensor would just hear silence, because the tentacles are not vibrating.

I am reasonably sure this is how ears work. And even if not, this idea works anyway. The dangley vibratey bits are obviously the thing that hears the sound, and restraining them, or cutting off the circulation, either way, would stop the organism from registering the sound.
I think this is a really cool idea! They should grow but slowly like in real life.
But only if there's a Dripstone Block underneath it.
The dripping stalactite should also grow downwards at the same time.
@Onidotmoe, yes that would be a very good idea.
@Yuurg,That would definitely make the gameplay a lot more interesting
Realistically, lava would do it faster, it just cools into stone when it hits the ground, rather than depositing sediment...
This is a very good idea I agree

I think it would be cool if some were biome specific, like could only be found in desert dig sites or jungle dig sites. Maybe some could only be obtained by trading with wandering traders.

Even cooler, if some were enchanted, they could give enchantments to the pot, like making it glow (more glow shards equals brighter glow) or giving a status effect while you’re touching it, like a mini beacon.
Finally add the red dragon as a shard.

Instead of 'dig sites' it would be great if archaeology paired with an overhaul of the oldest structures in the game (temples, dungeons, stronghold) and the addition of ruins on land to match the ones in the ocean.

Archaeology could be focused around the many structures in the game. Each structure would offer a pool of common shards (blank, tree, flower, animals..) and one or two shards unique to that structure. To collect all the shards in the game you would need to travel to a variety of structures sometimes visiting multiples of the same structure to claim the rarest shards and giving the player a reason to adventure out even into the late game. Shards then become trophies of your adventures as well as a story telling device allowing you to show off your rarest as pots and maybe also mosaics in item frames.

That way when you see a ruined portal or underwater ruin in the late game you don't just head their for the loot, you can also dig around for those missing shards from your collection.
I like this as it fits with the game and again adds strategy to mining, which was a large point of the Caves and Cliffs Update.

The problem I see with tgis is that coal is important in all biomes since it makes the first five nights survivable. Without coal or with too little of it it it would take ages to start a decent mine.

 

I like the concept of copper being more common in certain biomes though, but I don't know which biome this would be. It should be the one where copper is actually found in reality.

Overall I think it is a good idea, but I am not sure about it trying to attack pigs, villager, and creepers. The mob would have strategy to beat it because if you place a lightning rod on the ground it would attract its lightning and not let the lightning hit you. So I will vote for this idea.

A really good idea!
With this mob, you'll be the only Minecraft mob to control lightning!
I voted as soon as I saw the word “firefly”
This feels too similar to the lush caves in my opinion, plus it was already confirmed that dynamic lighting isn't coming in this update by Agnes I believe
It would be cooler if it generated beneath forest biomes and was the roots of the trees poking through from above.
If avalanches are added it could do the same
All for new uses for the absolutely worthless Bane of Arthropods enchantment
WHHHHYYYYY is this not in. It should have been added in 1.13. just amazing. Phenomenal work.
Dude you could have just said scuba gear?
But yeah the lead ore is a good idea including other ores *cough* MOJANG *cough*, possibly other crafting recipes and items?
Now is the time for lots of ores, at least five (not including the amethyst or copper)
JEOPHERNIX I just wanted to be specific cause if you look up scuba gear its like newer stuff where they have like flippers and a face mask and that's not what I had in mind.
I wouldn't add lead, but I do think it would be cool to have boots that make you sink faster. They could simply be the boots for the scuba gear

I wouldn't have a full suit of armor, I would just have the helmet. It should be crafted with copper and maybe glass panes. It may have an overlay of the old-fashioned diving suits. I also wouldn't have a tank, just make the helmet give you water breathing for a longer period than Turtle Shell helmets
DeftFan27146994 Then turtles will be 100% useless, as its way easier to find copper than find turtles+wait for scutes
I see that now. Perhaps Turtle Shell Helmets would be able to be upgraded with copper to become a diving helmet

401408658571 No, adding "at least five new ores" without any explanation of what they might be or how useful they are is what will ruin the game. In my opinion copper isn't useful enough as is, and will need more uses in future updates for me to even consider adding another overworld ore. 

As for the actual idea, I think the scuba gear has some merit, but the lead and oxygen tank should be taken away, the former not useful enough to add as a new ore and the latter being too modern. Instead of lead boots, Gold boots/armor should make you sink faster as it is very heavy. The lead in the crafting recipes should be replaced with iron or copper. With the oxygen gone, The scuba gear should double breathing time, increase swim speed, and increase vision underwater.

Question: why do the lead boots which make you fall faster decrease fall damage? If anything it should increase it.

This will add

a shine to your build!
Perhalps smelting snow, ice or varients thereof in a furnace, should produce water, if you put a bucket in the fuel slot.
This is cool but the job has already been taken over by regular ice blocks
do u perhaps mean the cauldron? if so, yes i thought abou this too!
In the... Boiler?
what exactly does this have to do with caves and cliffs? shouldnt this be posted in one of the other topics?
I like this idea, but this should ONLY work in seawater as pure water is a terrible conductor. Maybe you can use a bucket to collect seawater.
